You're also comparing when League had...what, a tiny fraction of it's player base and a single NA office vs. a global company running a game across the world. While you may not like what they say (and I sure don't sometimes), they are still one of the companies that communicate the most comparative to other industries. Do you think it's a coincidence that Overwatch has a dev-update almost every time there's a major patch?

[Or a dev corner where Riot communicates with players?](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner)

Or any number of random posts from guys like Meddler? Or Ghostcrawler doing a monthly QA about league?

Sure, they can't talk to us one-on-one as much as they used to but if we had Riot's old style for everyone you'd see a LOT more situations like Tryn saying Regi needs to invest more in league or the "i hate when people call us greedy" situation. It's not that they're intentionally malicious (at least not all the time) but having someone with a comms degree reading over your personal letter can mean a LOT when it comes to not pissing people off.....

(By no impact, I mean high impact, but adcs bitch their ever loving asses off if you so much as accidentally take a cs mid fight or god forbid take a kill/build one non support/defensive item.)

Maybe, but if you're playing in a competitive environment then sometimes things like 'fun' and 'want' will be sacrificed for the greater good, whether we want to admit it or not. I came from that same time period of "If you can't play all 5 roles, you shouldn't be playing ranked yet" and that mentality still remains for me, and will probably follow me into any other game I play with a ranked matchmaking mode that's taken at least sort of seriously. The conveniences are nice, but you should be able to function without those conveniences or other niceties should the need arise.

As a support main and generally mediocre, jack-of-all trades player who doesn't mind playing whatever role, I laugh at all the whining going on. You aren't going to die if you have to play support for one goddamn game. Well said, Dominick Destine, put the brats in their place.

To be honest, I liked the old system better. I liked not knowing what role I was going to play, and then having to mold my playstyle for the game. It made it a lot more diverse and fun. And I felt more proficient at the game. Sure I got to gold in season 6 by spamming Anivia in mid, but I feel like I liked it when one game I could go top, another ADC, another support and be progressing in all the roles. You can tell who is an old school player and who isn't by how much they think damage is too high right now.

Champions have never been as tanky as they are now. Look at your hp bar at level 6 when you are an ADC and only have a Doran's Blade. If you played in Season 1-2, you know you're tanky as hell.

Remember playing Tryndamere on old Twisted Treeline ? Poor level 1 Annie walks in the botlane bush, you hit her 3 times, 2 of your hits are critical strikes, you get 400 gold.

_Where did she go ?_

That's what she gets for having such a ridiculous HP bar.

Back in my days, having 600-700 hp at level 1 meant you used all your runes in flat HP, had bought a 475 PO Ruby Crystal and were playing Garen or Dr. Mundo. You didn't see an Ezreal do the same with a [Dolan's Blade](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/KID2rEhl49U/hqdefault.jpg).
